required_answer: Object-oriented programming is a programming paradigm that is based on the concept of objects.

The SOLID principles are a set of design principles that aim to make software designs more understandable, flexible, and maintainable. The principles are: Single Responsibility Principle (SRP), Open-Closed Principle (OCP), Liskov Substitution Principle (LSP), Interface Segregation Principle (ISP), Dependency Inversion Principle (DIP).
